current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To ensure that emergency services volunteers are not counted as full-time employees under the shared responsibility requirements contained in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Protecting Volunteer Firefighters and Emergency Responders Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Volunteer Firefighters and Emergency Responders Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: For purposes of this section, a qualified emergency services volunteer shall not be counted in determining the number of full-time employees who are employed by an employer.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: performing fire fighting and prevention services, emergency medical services, or ambulance services for an eligible employer, as defined by

term.#tail: means any bona fide volunteer, as defined by

header.#text: Definition of qualified emergency services volunteer

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) in any capacity other than the treatment of such volunteers under the shared responsibility provision for employers with respect to health coverage under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

text.#text: Nothing in this section, or the amendment made by this section, shall be construed to modify the treatment of qualified emergency services volunteers (as defined in
